abstract: Persistent housing segregation lies at the root of many of our societyâ€™s problems. Trump wants to make it worse.
lead_paragraph: In the mid-20th century, federal, state and local governments pursued explicit racial policies to create, enforce and sustain residential segregation. The policies were so powerful that, as a result, even today blacks and whites rarely live in the same communities and have little interracial contact or friendships outside the workplace.
